intro: Sphaeralcea polychroma, commonly known as the multicolored globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that come in a variety of colors, including yellow, orange, and red. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Sphaeralcea polychroma is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
